jobs.description:
Here at Amazon we are currently seeking for an experienced Regional Operations Manager to oversee our logistics operations in the northern region, encompassing New South Wales and Queensland.

Amazon Logistics (AMZL) is an innovative delivery network designed to bring packages directly to customers quickly, cost-effectively, and with a focus on exceptional customer service. As we continue to expand our operations in Australia, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced Regional Operations Manager to oversee our logistics operations in the northern region, encompassing New South Wales and Queensland.

The Regional Operations Manager will be responsible for leading and optimizing the end-to-end delivery operations across NSW and QLD. This role requires a strategic thinker with strong operational expertise who can drive continuous improvement, manage large teams, and ensure customer satisfaction while meeting business objectives.

Key Job Responsibilities:
- Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance operational efficiency and expand AMZL's presence in the northern region,
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align regional operations with overall business goals and customer needs,
- Oversee daily operations of multiple delivery stations and logistics hubs across NSW and QLD,
- Implement and maintain standard operating procedures to ensure consistency and quality across all sites,
- Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimize processes, reduce costs, and increase productivity,
- Lead, mentor, and develop a large team of operations managers, supervisors, and support staff,
- Foster a culture of safety, innovation, and customer-centricity among all team members,
- Recruit, train, and retain top talent to support the region's growth and operational needs,
- Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for delivery accuracy, timeliness, and customer satisfaction,
- Analyze data and metrics to identify trends, challenges, and opportunities for improvement,
- Implement corrective actions and best practices to address performance gaps,
- Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, including senior leadership, product teams, and other regional managers,
- Collaborate with external partners, including delivery service providers, to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance,
- Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and Amazon policies across the region,
- Implement and maintain robust risk management strategies to mitigate operational and safety risks,
- Stay abreast of industry trends and technological advancements in logistics and supply chain management,
- Champion the adoption of new technologies and innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency and customer experience.

jobs.description:
IT PnD organization is seeking a BIE Manager to join our Data and Analytics team. As a BIE Mgr with our team, you will be working in a large, complex and dynamic, data-driven environment with limited guidance. You will be responsible for leading the design and implementation of complex BI solutions, defining team strategy, and influencing organizational BI architecture.
This position requires the candidate to work efficiently on complex and ambiguous problem areas, take a long-term view of solutions, and demonstrate technical leadership. You will need to develop deep understanding of data lineage across the organization, earn trust with senior leadership through strategic insights, and drive business understanding through robust, scalable solutions.
To succeed, you must have the ability to lead large projects requiring multiple team members, make appropriate technical trade-offs for long-term needs, and communicate effectively with management audiences through narratives and strategic recommendations


Key job responsibilities
• Lead the design, implementation, and delivery of BI solutions for complex and ambiguous problems
• Take ownership of BI infrastructure and provide system-wide design guidance
• Drive BI engineering best practices and set standards for operational excellence
• Perform complex business analysis and provide strategic recommendations to senior leadership
• Design and implement technical solutions with appropriate analytics strategy and data set design
• Lead large projects that require work of multiple team members, dividing work effectively
• Mentor and develop other BIEs, providing technical assessments for BIE II and BIE III promotions
• Build consensus and resolve contentious technical issues across teams
• Influence organizational BI architecture and cross-team data strategies
• Communicate findings and strategic insights to management audiences

A day in the life
A day in the life of a BIE Manager at IT PnD involves leading complex, large-scale initiatives and providing technical leadership to the team. The day typically starts with strategic planning and architecture discussions, followed by hands-on work on the most critical solutions. You'll spend time mentoring junior team members, conducting design reviews, and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across the organization to ensure BI solutions align with business strategy. The day includes making key technical trade-offs, managing the team and driving best practices that impact the entire organization, all while maintaining Amazon's high standards of operational excellence.

jobs.description:
Our WW Operations network delivers millions of packages and smiles to Amazon customers every day. We are looking for motivated, customer-focused individuals who want to join our team as an Area Manager. In this role, you will lead a team of hourly workforce and will be responsible for engaging your team during their shifts to maintain the highest levels of safety, quality, attendance, and performance. You will also play a key role in maintaining our customer expectations to ensure customer orders are delivered at the right time, to the right location.

Our Operation’s workflow has three major components: First mile - where the product is housed and ready for order; Middle mile - where the order is hauled to your area; and Last mile - when the product is delivered to the customer’s door. Please note that all workflows have slight building variations, but one thing is constant: our vision and dedication to the customer.

Key job responsibilities
* Support, mentor, and motivate your hourly workforce
* Manage safety, quality, productivity, and customer delivery promises
* Collaborate with all support teams including Safety, Engineering, Loss Prevention, Quality Assurance, Human Resources to develop plans to meet business objectives
* Lift up to 49 pounds and frequently push, pull, squat, bend, and reach
* Stand/walk for up to 12 hours during shifts
* Work in an environment where the noise level varies and can be loud
* Work in an environment that is subject to variable temperatures and weather (delivery stations include outside loading departments)
* Continuously climb and descend stairs (applies to sites with stairs)
* Manage and interact with associates in both English and/or Spanish
* Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and procedures. At times this may require the need to support in both English and/or Spanish, depending on the associate population need.

Our fulfillment network launches new Operations sites every year, providing various opportunities for your professional growth. We hire Area Managers based on location preference and the business’ current openings.

jobs.description:
Job summary
Our WW Operations network delivers millions of packages and smiles to Amazon customers every day. We are looking for motivated, customer-focused individuals who want to join our team as an Operations Manager. In this role, you will lead and develop a team of salaried and hourly talent. You will be responsible for engaging your team during their shifts to maintain the highest levels of safety, quality, attendance, and performance. To achieve this, managers are expected to provide their team with the tools needed for success while driving improvements in productivity and efficiency through data-driven decisions and analytical problem-solving. You will also play a key role in maintaining our customer expectations to ensure customer orders are delivered at the right time, to the right location.

Our Operation’s workflow has three major components: First mile - where the product is housed and ready for order; Middle mile - where the order is hauled to your area; and Last mile - when the product is delivered to the customer’s door. Please note that all workflows have slight building variations, but one thing is constant: our vision and dedication to the customer.

Key Responsibilities and Job Elements:
- Support, mentor, and motivate your salaried and hourly workforce
- Lead large-scope projects with site and regional impact
- Build and execute productivity plans through forecast reviews, determining productivity requirements, and partnering with other Leaders to load balance
- Manage safety, quality, productivity, and customer delivery promises
- Collaborate with all support teams including Safety, Engineering, Loss Prevention, Quality Assurance, Human Resources to develop plans to meet business objectives
- Lift up to 49 pounds and frequently push, pull, squat, bend, and reach
- Stand/walk for up to 12 hours during shifts
- Work in an environment where the noise level varies and can be loud
- Work in an environment that is subject to variable temperatures and weather (delivery stations include outside loading departments)
- Continuously climb and descend stairs (applies to sites with stairs)
Our fulfillment network launches new Operations sites every year, providing various opportunities for your professional growth. We hire Operations Managers based on location preference and the business’ current openings.
